page.title: 08HACKLINGE AREA PLANNING
page.content: The region is classified as prime agricultural land in the Kent Struct- ure Plan so no new building is allowed apart from infilling in already deve- loped residential areas. There is one listed building, Upton House, Worth, built in the l8th. cen- tury. The present owners have Dover District Council planning permission to turn it into an Old People's Home. The Martha Trust at The Elms, Hack- linge have plans to turn outbuildings into an eight-bedded Home for Mentally and Physically Handicapped Children. Although no new building is allowed plans to convert old barns and similar structures for residential use are invariably passed unless local opin- ions are strongly against them.
